page.title: 15LIFE IN LINDFIELD
page.content: LIFE IN LINDFIELD LIFE IN LINDFIELD IS CENTRED ON ONE OR MORE OF THREE FEATURES WHICH ARE TYPICAL OF AN ENGLISH VILLAGE_THE ANCIENT CHURCH,THE POND AND THE COMMON.THE CHURCH STANDS AT THE TOP OF THE HIGH STREET WHICH HAS MODERN RETAIL SHOPS IN ITS ANCIENT BUILDINGS.TWO SWANS RESIDE ON THE POND AND ANNUALLY DRIVE AWAY OTHER WILD LIFE TO SUPPORT THEIR YOUNG.AS WELL AS BEING THE CENTRE OF VILLAGE SPORTING LIFE ,THE COMMON IS USED TO STAGE VILLAGE DAY,THE ANNUAL BONFIRE NIGHT CELEBRATION AND THE SUMMER FAIR OF VILLAGE SCHOOLS,ONE OF WHICH HAS OCCUPIED A CORNER OF THE COMMON SINCE 1881. A MAJOR PORTION OF THE POPULATION COMMUTES DAILY TO LONDON: OTHERS WORK IN LOCAL EMPLOYMENT CENTRES LIKE GATWICK AIRPORT AND BRIGHTON. ENTERTAINMENT IS CLUB BASED.
